intro: Antennaria spathulata, commonly known as the spoonleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and fleshy, succulent-like leaves. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its unique morphology includes spoon-shaped leaves and pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. Antennaria spathulata is often found in open, sunny habitats and is considered a characteristic species of subalpine and alpine zones.
